poem:
"A Titan on Tempest Seas"

The sea, once a virgin in salt-kissed breeze,
Now cradles a behemoth with frightening ease.
A tower afloat, commands the waves,
Behind it trails a toxic rave.
Seven thousand souls roam free, atop
The monster belching smoke non-stop.
Proud human hands have unleased upon the blue,
An icon bearing weight, if only they knew.
